channel.title: < and >
channel.description:
Does anyone know how to make <'s and >'s work? Being a noob at coding clients, I have no idea, I tried searching some tutorials, but I obviously can't word my sentences correctly if there are any out there.
Thanks :)
PS: I'll be on for a while, so if you have any questions about the client, just PM me.

item.title: < and >
item.dc:creator: @T7S T7S
item.description:
@T7S wrote:

AtomicInt_:

Because it is not made for the #317 revision, you’ll have to do some converting and renaming.

Ehh, I found a 317 Galkons. I converted it all and added a “getColorByName” method. So it’s like <col=red> See

Lets hope that the <'s worked in that.

Read full topic

item.title: < and >
item.dc:creator: @T7S T7S
item.description:
@T7S wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:11, topic:480118”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=598353.msg4208844#msg4208844 date=1359275044]
Look for: validChars
In your TextInput class.
[/quote]

Only changes characters able to be inputted on the Title Screen, not a solution to his issue.

@OP, you would need to get the latest Text Engine and implement it into your client. (Can be found on Rune-Server)
Also, this should go in Client Help.[/quote]

Thanks, and sorry, I didn’t know which it was. >->

The new text engine gives me over 100 errors…

Read full topic

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:10, topic:480118”]Look for: validChars
In your TextInput class.[/quote]

Only changes characters able to be inputted on the Title Screen, not a solution to his issue.

@OP, you would need to get the latest Text Engine and implement it into your client. (Can be found on Rune-Server)
Also, this should go in Client Help.

item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I recall seeing a guide on R-S which updated it to the 474 revision, it was client sided.
474 may have it but I’m sure you could make sense of how to do it after examining the guide, examining a 474 client and a 508 client. It’d take a while but with trial n error you’d get their;o.

Read full topic

item.title: < and >
item.dc:creator: @T7S T7S
item.description:
@T7S wrote:

When you type < in on the client, it hides it completely and if you were to press enter, to send the text, it won’t show.

The same goes with > except you can see that one.

I want to make it so that they both work.

Read full topic
